name: AdjustStock
description:
Book a set of Adjustments to modify stock.

An Adjustment should have a `ProductID` to identify the product, an `OrganizationUnitID` to identify the stock keeping organization, a `StockLabelID` (see `GetEnumValues` with type `StockLabel`),
a `StockMutationReasonID` (see `GetEnumValues` with type `StockMutationReasons`) and of course a `Quantity` to actually book.

Supply a `BackendSystemID` on the request and `BackendID`'s on the Adjustments to make the request idempotent (optional). When one adjustment in your request fails, all of them will fail. Duplicate
keys will not be processed again and yield a warning (but thus will not block!).

Optionally supports a `Remark` for each Adjustment.

When specifying a `SerialNumber`, please note the `Quantity` of this adjustment then should either be -1 or 1!
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `AdjustStock:None`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

C.name: BackendID
C.description: Optional, unique identifier for the mutation, combined with the root `BackendSystemID`

C.name: OrganizationUnitID
C.description: This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

C.name: ProductID
C.description:
Required product identifier (use the `EVA-IDs-Mode` header to switch identifier keys (`Product.ID`, `Product.BackendID`, ...)

This is the ID of a `Product`

C.name: StockLabelID
C.description: This is the ID of a `StockLabel`

C.name: StockMutationReasonID
C.description: This is the ID of a `StockMutationReasons`

B.name: BackendSystemID
B.description: Optional, unique identifier for the system that owns the `Adjustment.BackendID` as key for the mutation

E.name: Code
E.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

E.name: Message
E.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

E.name: RequestID
E.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

E.name: Type
E.description: A short description of the error type.

F.name: ExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

F.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
F.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

F.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
